TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit X509ExtensionEnumerator extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.IEnumerator

Docs.summary: Supports a simple iteration over a . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Enumerators provide read-only access to the data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Reset%2A> also brings the enumerator back to this position. At this position, calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Current%2A> throws an exception. Therefore, you must call <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Current%2A>.
This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface. For more information about enumerating over a collection, see the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> topic.

Docs.summary: Gets the current element in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator> does not move the position of the enumerator and consecutive calls to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Current%2A> return the same object until either <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Reset%2A> is called.

Docs.exception: The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveNext() cil managed

Docs.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element in the .
Docs.returns: if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method advances the enumerator to the next element in the collection. This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface. For more information about enumerating over a collection, see the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> topic.

Docs.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Reset%2A> throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

Docs.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

Docs.summary: Gets an object from a collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator> does not move the position of the enumerator and consecutive calls to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Current%2A> return the same object until either <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator.Reset%2A> is called.

Docs.exception: The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.
